intro: Comopycna, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent petals that resemble the appearance of ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its unique morphology includes a short stem with a single, elongated inflorescence. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, Comopycna is considered a rare and poorly understood botanical specimen.
